content.title: Agriculture And Processed Foods Export Promotion Scheme Of APEDA For The 15th Finance Commission Cycle (2021-22 To 2025-26)
content.beneficiary: APEDA registered exporters, Certification Bodies, State Agencies, trade bodies, Chambers of Commerce, Government agencies, FPO, SHG, FPC, Cooperatives, individual farmers, and listed laboratories
content.details: The Financial Assistance Scheme (FAS) is an export promotion scheme run by APEDA. The scheme aims to facilitate the export of agri-products by providing assistance to exporters. It is implemented for the period of 2021-22 to 2025-26.
benefits: Assistance up to 50% of the total cost subject to a ceiling of Rs. 5 lakh and 20 lakh per certification.
Assistance for the renewal of certifications.
Assistance for procuring hand-held devices including the cost of software for capturing farm-level peripheral coordinates for traceability systems.
eligibility: APEDA registered Exporters are eligible to apply for assistance.
Central and state government institutions and public sector enterprises are eligible to apply for assistance.
Assistance will be applicable for all APEDA scheduled products.
exclusions: Members who are not registered with APEDA are not eligible to apply for assistance under the scheme.
content.application_process: Online application through the APEDA website.
documents_required: Certificate of incorporation/registration of the applicant
Annual reports and Audited Financial Statement of Accounts of the applicant for the last two years.
Self-attested English/Hindi version of main facility land documents.
Three quotations from suppliers of Plant and machinery.

faqs.question: What is APEDA?
faqs.answer: The Agricultural and Processed Food Products Export Development Authority (APEDA) was established by the Government of India to promote the export of agricultural and processed food products.

faqs.question: What are the Financial Assistance Schemes of APEDA?
faqs.answer: The Financial Assistance Scheme (FAS) is an export promotion scheme run by APEDA to facilitate the export of agri-products.
